title: This game will never be a sport...
body:
I read in a Riot interview that they intend for League of Legends to become a sporting event and reach the same level as football/soccer. I can assure you that this is never going to happen because the players of sports do not continually shout death threats at each other while an incompetent corporate developer continues to mess around with stuff.

Part of the reason sports, Tennis, Football, etc have stood the test of time is because there are set, clearly defined rules that players need to abide by. Making the game accessible for new players and old veterans alike. League has none of this as Riot continually change the game every season to resemble something totally different from the last season and there is no actual consistency.

They continually run the game through power "cycles" where one specific champion type is dominant before being knocked down hard. As is with this season which has seen a huge rise in marksman in lanes other then bot. Once the assassin rework is released, the assassins that have been tuned with the same power creep that the marksman have will be knocked off the top spot. 

Traditional Sports and Games do not change their rules every year in order to increase appeal. They use a tried and true formula that remains constant (the rules of chess, for example have existed for almost 900 years in its current form).  This is why League of Legends will never achieve the level of traditional sports and Riot are frankly arrogant for believing that. 

Plus, nobody really wants to play a game where 9/10 players that get a kill on you are arrogant jerks about it. I have barely met ANY good players on this game, like I have on Overwatch or SMITE which seem to have more laid back communities. Most people in this game, if they get a kill would rather be cocky and say "Ez" then actually saying "I was lucky" or "Wow, that was close". You know, just to make the enemy FEEL better about possibly losing the game. 

You do not see people playing amateur at any sport, beating each other up over a mistake or going "haha" to the enemy. (Except Boxing)

replies.body: You say people don't yell death threats, but have you seen die hard soccer fans? They will follow through with their threats.

BUT

THE RULES OF THE GAME ARE DESTROY THE ENEMY NEXUS?

THAT RULE HAS NEVER CHANGED SO THEREFORE YOUR POSTING IS NOW INVALID

GOOD DAY SIR!{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I guess you didn't know that Worlds was hosted on multiple TV channels like ESPN ._.
I don't know tbh. I have never seen ESPN on TV here in europe, so I wouldn't take it as an example to explain something to the OP. Point still stands
They would have to ferret out the stinkers overshadowing the summoners on the battlefield. That is accomplished through transparency which eliminates opportunities for the foolish to screw around.

You honestly think sports rules and regulations haven't changed before?

We'd still be playing football in the snow.
Game is still growing. It's amazing it got this far.

And yet it has things like spamming mastery emotes and laughs/taunts. 

And before anyone tells me to grow a hide or something, I don't personally care about it. In fact I usually roll my eyes or laugh to myself at how the people spamming masteries are usually the ones doing worst in their team. But it does tilt my teammates, which affects me in a way I can't do anything about.

There is only 1 time spamming mastery is acceptable and that's if you're doing something legitimately hilarious and using it to make it better.

Example: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BrP0H-n0x3Q

League's competitive scene changes too frequently. Professional players have an average career length of around 2 years, at most. 

Why? Because they all realize how bullshit it is to try to perform competitively under the constant, massive changes they make to the game.

___________

Compare THAT to traditional sports. You'll see League treats its professionals like shit in that regard. THAT is why it will never achieve the vision that Riot has for it.

> You do not see people playing amateur at any sport, beating each other up over a mistake or going "haha" to the enemy.

what kind of sports do you watch, because that stuff happens more in professional leagues than in professional play like the LCS. I think you're trying to compare the non-competitive part of the league community (aka, anyone that plays it for entertainment so like...most Master tier players and below) to professional sport leagues which is an unfair comparison.

not to mention that videogaming (including league) is already considered a "sport" by many governments and League itself has the same reputation, if not *more* than Baseball/Soccer/Tennis/etc in places like Korea. To say it's not possible is simply not true when you consider that it's already been done in other countries for the same game.

there's also the fact that they are making *amazing* progress at a college level, for which I am extremely excited and proud about. They are expanding faster than I would've expected at least.
